name: Anix Lynch
title: Venture Capital, Managing Partner | PE/VC Investment Professional
summary: Anix is a Managing Partner at Expara Thailand. She has over 20 years of experience with track record over $2B in PE/VC. She leads the firm's overall efforts in launching Thailand's sovereign wealth VC Fund and has been instrumental and prolific in establishing partnerships with other VCs, startup hubs and govt. agencies for the firm. As a brainchild of True Digital Park, Thailand 4.0, and Techsauce FAB stage, she is recognized by Thailand's top ecosystem builders and now a board member, advisor, mentor to numerous start-ups. She is a frequent panelist and speaker on entrepreneurship and VC-related topics. Anix serves as an visit lecturer in Entrepreneurship in the MBA program at Sasin and Chicago Booth MBA and was named one of Thailand's Top Female VCs.

experience.title: Managing Partner
experience.full_description: SEA's early stage venture capital firm with successful exits (2C2P, Co-asset). Run a government-backed VC fund. (up to $1M check size) Lead investor/Director at Ooca, Event Banana, Peak Engine, One Stockhome. Managing team of 3 FTE associate, 6 vendors, 2 LPs, 8 accelerators, and 40+ VCs and 6 media partners. Fund formation and day-to-day operation in collaboration with Government Saving Bank and Stock Exchange of Thailand. Manage end-to-end deal sourcing to closing. Screened over 700+ deal per year (Fintech, DeepTech, AI, HealthTech, Blockchain, EdTech, Real Estate Tech). Recruited 8+ core members to startups portfolio and LPs. Developed screening criteria, cap table, waterfall structure, portfolio construction, deal flow CRM, key success metrics and commercialization plans. Flagship program: Created Techsauce "FAB" (Food/Agri/Biotech). Built 15 future-forward stages discussing topics such as "Genome Editing" "Bringing Scifi to food with CRISPR" "Food Blockchain" "Menu of 2030" "How to make farmer job better?" "3D Printing - Organ on Demand" "BioHacking" "Social Dilemma in BioTech" "Tasty VS Healthy, can we have both?". Key speakers including Indiebio, Agfunder, SproutX and Top Ittipat (Taokaenoi). Helped Techsauce growing audience from 10,000 to 15,000. Currently actively building community of FAB with 500 startup.
achievements: Successful exits: 2C2P, Co-asset
Screened 700+ deals per year
Built Techsauce FAB community of 500 startups
Grew Techsauce audience from 10,000 to 15,000
Recruited 8+ core members to startups portfolio and LPs
Developed screening criteria, cap table, waterfall structure, portfolio construction, deal flow CRM

metrics.team_size: 3 FTE associates, 6 vendors, 2 LPs, 8 accelerators, 40+ VCs, 6 media partners

experience.title: CEO - Innovative Policy Consulting
experience.full_description: Innovative Policy Consulting. In 2014, initiated and worked with VC globally to propose "Bangkok Beta" plan (Today known as "Thailand 4.0") to Ministry of ICT/Ministry of Science and True Telecom to build an innovative country by setting 2025 vision. Synthetized "A Call-To-Action Formula" by identifying incentives/obstacles for all ecosystem participants. Transferred to startup association for detailed development. Silicon Valley tour. Google, Facebook, Uber, Airbnb, OpenDoor, Khosla Venture, Horizon Venture, Bill Gate Foundation, Instagram, Spotify, Plug and Play Tech Center, SAP Ventures, 500 startups, Hampton Creek, Instacart, Beyond Meat. Predicted and visualized Thai new economy in 2015. 3 years later, 17+ out of 26 suggestions are in implementation in Thai startup economy. Estimated GDP impact, cost of startup ecosystem development in order to produce 1-5 tech unicorns in 8 years with budget of USD $395M+.
achievements: Initiated Bangkok Beta plan (now Thailand 4.0)
17+ out of 26 suggestions implemented in Thai startup economy
Estimated GDP impact: $395M+ budget for 1-5 tech unicorns in 8 years
Recognized by True Corporation as 'Tech ecosystem alliance'
One Stop Shop and Smart Visa plan approved by BOI
First time Venture Capital and startup taxes waived
ICT announced $560M funding ( $160M over budget)
Thailand's Ease of Doing Business improved by 3 points (World Bank)

experience.title: VP - Business Intelligence
experience.full_description: MQDC is a private real estate fund and philanthropic arms of Chearavanont family, owner of world's top innovative firm CP Group, Forbes's No.1 wealthiest family in South East Asia. Concept invention, deal origination, feasibility, global partner sourcing. (Avg. deal size $500M). Signature Projects: Originated 1st draft of "True Digital Park" concept. Successfully drove JV between MQDC/True, USD$568M, 10,000 Sqm. Successfully launched in 2018. Worked with virgin group to develop Whizdom101 (USD$1.5 B), one of Thailand's largest mixed-use development with vertical sport club and smart home. Lease 50%+, Sold over 80%. Initiated and led JV of CP Group Sky Urban Solution Singapore. Pingu- Future of Aging Hub, Shanghai ($162M, 246-beds). Feasibility analysis with Fortress Investment Group. (Unrealized due to change in China zoning regulations). Co-investment Analysis- Hampton Creek - Alternative Egg and planted based meal replacement funded by Bill Gates and Li ka Shing.
achievements: Originated True Digital Park concept ($568M, 10,000 Sqm)
Developed Whizdom101 with Virgin Group ($1.5B, 50%+ lease, 80%+ sold)
Led CP Group Sky Urban Solution Singapore JV
Pingu Future of Aging Hub feasibility ($162M, 246-beds)
Co-investment analysis for Hampton Creek (Bill Gates, Li ka Shing backed)

experience.title: General Manager - DT Family Foundation
experience.full_description: Led UBS to launch DT Family Foundation, an impact-first philanthropic trust in Hong Kong to invest 2% of revenue for sustainability. DT Trust is now supporting over 400 schools, social entrepreneurs, and disaster victims around the globe. CEO was recognized as "Forbes Asia's Philanthropist". Led 40-year future planning, deal structuring and global partnership. Identified direct tech investment opportunities for CP/MQDC/True (Future of food, automated agriculture, vertical farming smart home, robotics, CreTech).
achievements: Launched DT Family Foundation (impact-first philanthropic trust)
Foundation supports 400+ schools, social entrepreneurs, disaster victims
CEO recognized as Forbes Asia's Philanthropist
Led 40-year future planning
Identified tech investment opportunities (food, agriculture, vertical farming, robotics, CreTech)

experience.title: Asset Manager
experience.full_description: Independent management firm specialized in Asian hospitality industry with US $30bn+ in loan and real estate asset portfolios since 1998. Directed redevelopment and rebranded Avenue shopping mall (75 retail tenants), cinema and parking complex in Kobe, Japan. Day-to-day liaison with InterContinental Hotels. Supervised 18 Japanese property managers; analyzed seasonal rent and tenant mix. Designed and implemented foot traffic improvement plans. Led negotiations of $130M loan facility with Mizuho Bank on behalf of TCC Group.
achievements: Directed redevelopment of Avenue shopping mall (75 retail tenants)
Supervised 18 Japanese property managers
Led $130M loan facility negotiation with Mizuho Bank
Designed foot traffic improvement plans

experience.title: Investment Associate
experience.full_description: Ranked by PERE in 2011 as the world's largest private equity real estate investment firm, managing US$11bn in assets throughout Europe and Asia. Exited to BlackRock. Conducted acquisition analysis for real estate investments in Japan. Transactions included Storia Shinagawa Tokyo (202 residential units, US$99.7m), Shirokanedai Building (Grade A Office, US$116m) and Kameido (Grade B Office, US$35m). Avg. Project IRR 25%+, EM 2x. Prepared hold/sell analyses and investment performance results for quarterly reports and reviews, board and IC meetings. Managed investment analysis for single residential and retail assets ranged from US$30m to US$116m.
achievements: Conducted acquisition analysis for $250M+ in transactions
Achieved avg. IRR 25%+, Equity Multiple 2x
Managed investment analysis for assets $30M-$116M

experience.title: CEO Office Manager
experience.full_description: Japan's first REIT focusing in residential and industrial deals formed by CBRE Global Investor. Planned and executed marketing for an onshore / offshore opportunistic real estate fund valued at US$1bn â€“ produced private placement memoranda, road show presentations, etc. and coordinated due diligence questionnaires for foreign financial institutions and public pension funds. Report to COO, FP&A analysis of Residential Real Estate Fund, $700M+, average IRR +22% portfolio focus in residential and commercial assets in Japan, Korea and China. Proposed and applied an e-approval process and database to centralize subsidiaries' information, saved $500k annually.
achievements: Planned marketing for $1bn real estate fund
FP&A analysis for $700M+ Residential Real Estate Fund
Achieved avg. IRR 22%
Saved $500k annually with e-approval process

experience.company: Apple International Company Ltd, Mie, Japan
experience.title: Strategic Planning
experience.full_description: Japan-HK based listed car dealership and exporter (Tokyo Stock Exchange, TSE: 2788). Prepared Japanese prospectus and a private offering memorandum 6 months before IPO. Successfully listed at Tokyo Stock Exchange. Published IR annual report on quarterly basis. Assisted Credit Suisse in due diligence to acquired 2 Thai, 6 Chinese dealers. Post M&A integration. Led 14 staffs in Hong Kong, China, and Indonesia accounting team to produce consolidated 10-K, 10-Q for Financial Service Agency in Japan. Led JV with Thanachart Scotia Bank to build Thailand's first car auction "Apple Auto-Auction" through licensing of Japanese technology. Setup 58,000 sqm auction facility in Bangkok. Secured 2nd largest market share at year 4 of penetration. (+60,000 cars auctioned/month).
achievements: Successfully listed company at Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE: 2788)
Assisted Credit Suisse in acquiring 2 Thai, 6 Chinese dealers
Led JV to build Thailand's first car auction (Apple Auto-Auction)
Secured 2nd largest market share (60,000+ cars/month)
